block.p: Martha Eleanor Fanning, a daughter of Muffie Van Voorhis of Barter's Island, Me., and the late James Erskin Fanning, was married yesterday to Bryan Macleod Smith, a son of the late Lorna Macleod Smith and Stephen Smith. The Rev. Peter B. Panagore performed the ceremony at the Congregational Church in Booth Bay Harbor, Me.

Mrs. Smith, 29, is an account coordinator at Communicators International, a public relations and advertising company in Portland, Me. She graduated from Drew University. Her father was a president at Rockefeller & Company, which manages investments for the Rockefeller family and other individual and institutional clients, in New York. Her mother retired as a history teacher at the Kent Place School in Summit, N.J.

Martha Eleanor Fanning, a daughter of Muffie Van Voorhis of Barter's Island, Me., and the late James Erskin Fanning, was married yesterday to Bryan Macleod Smith, a son of the late Lorna Macleod Smith and Stephen Smith. The Rev. Peter B. Panagore performed the ceremony at the Congregational Church in Booth Bay Harbor, Me.

Mrs. Smith, 29, is an account coordinator at Communicators International, a public relations and advertising company in Portland, Me. She graduated from Drew University. Her father was a president at Rockefeller & Company, which manages investments for the Rockefeller family and other individual and institutional clients, in New York. Her mother retired as a history teacher at the Kent Place School in Summit, N.J.

Mr. Smith, 29, is an owner and the head brewmaster of the Casco Bay Brewing Company in Portland. He graduated from Hobart College. His father was a managing partner in Jones-Hoxie, an insurance company in Augusta, Me.
